at.nineyards.anyline.camera

Class AnylineBaseView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.CameraView
          • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.AnylineBaseView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnylineView

    public class AnylineBaseView
extends CameraView

    A view that combines the CameraView, the CutoutView (and the SimpleFlashView.

    This view can be configured using an AnylineViewConfig. A "cutout" can be defined where the object to scan should be placed. This cutout can be visualized in different ways. This view keeps the cutout that is visualized and the area that is cropped out of the image in sync.

    For xml configuration the AnylineView can be used.

        public void setConfigFromAsset(java.lang.String jsonFileName)

        Set the config to this view from the specified json file (relative path within assets-dir).

        This sets a new config, overriding/deleting values that may have been set in xml.

        Parameters:
        jsonFileName - the json file with the config (including relative path within assets-dir)
        See Also:
        setConfig(AnylineViewConfig), setConfigFromJsonString(String)

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(AnylineViewConfig config)

        Set the config to this view.
        Changes to the preview size only have an effect before the camera initialisation. If the cutout is changed after that, you have to call updateCutoutView() for the changes to have an effect.

        This overrides/deletes values that may have been set in xml.

        Parameters:
        config - the config to use

      • getConfig

        public AnylineViewConfig getConfig()
        Get the currently used config.

        Changes should always be saved with setConfig(AnylineViewConfig)

        Returns:
        the currently used config.

        Parameters:

      • enableBarcodeDetection

        public void enableBarcodeDetection(boolean scanOnFullImage,
                                   @NonNull
                                   NativeBarcodeResultListener barcodeResultListener)
        (This is a ALPHA implementation, may change in future)
        Allows to search for barcodes simultaneously on the same image. Barcodes may be searched on the full preview image, or in the cutout area only.

        The listener will be called every time an image is analyzed and barcodes are found e.g. the results are independent from the module's result.

        NOTE: this will only work if the device has the Google Play Service installed. Have a look on the suggested methods to ensure the device is ready: https://developers.google.com/android/guides/setup. Also, you need to include Google Play Services in your app. For the barcode reader you need to include Mobile Vision version 7.8.0 or higher (recommended) in the build.gradle (see also vision release notes)

        Parameters:
        scanOnFullImage - if true the full image (e.g. the preview image) will be scanned for barcodes, if false only the cutout area is considered
        barcodeResultListener - the listener will be called whenever barcodes have been found on an image, note that is independent from the module's result listener

      • disableBarcodeDetection

        public void disableBarcodeDetection()
        Disables the barcode detection if it has been enabled before. see also enableBarcodeDetection(boolean, NativeBarcodeResultListener)

        Description copied from class: CameraView

      • openCameraInBackground

        public void openCameraInBackground()
        Description copied from class: CameraView
        Open the camera in a background thread, if surface is already created and camera is not opened already. Reports opening or error to the CameraOpenListener set with CameraView.setCameraOpenListener(CameraOpenListener).
        Overrides:
        openCameraInBackground in class CameraView

      • releaseCameraInBackground

        public void releaseCameraInBackground()
        Description copied from class: CameraView

        Release the camera in a background thread. Camera releasing may take a bit, so it may interfere with your exit animation. Use this to do it in the background.

        ALWAYS call this or CameraView.releaseCamera() in onPause of your activity!!

        Overrides:
        releaseCameraInBackground in class CameraView

      • releaseCamera

        public void releaseCamera()
        Description copied from class: CameraView

        Release the camera.

        ALWAYS call this or CameraView.releaseCameraInBackground() in onPause of your activity!!

        Overrides:
        releaseCamera in class CameraView
